subject: VAM Pro mounting into throttle
description_text:
Hi-
I just received the VAM pro Haptics. However, when I try mountains with the
throttle, there’s a plate on the back of the throttle, preventing the
second screw from threading through, It’s like the hole is out of
alignment.

How do you recommend I get the second screw throw through? Does this back
panel need to come off too? If so, how?

I’ve attached pictures for you.

Thanks,
Nick

conversations.body_text: Hi Nick Dodson,  Is one of the two screws not long enough, or is one of them misaligned?

One of them is misaligned due to the black plate that is located in the
upper throttle part. In that black plate, there are two holes. Only one is
usable and aligns with one hole on the pedal itself. There’s no way to put
the 2nd bolt through the pedal plate in the black plate as well.

On Sun, Aug 10, 2025 at 7:44 PM service@simsonn.com
Hi Nick Dodson,    You can try installing it this way.

Hello-
Thank you for the help. So it's OK to have just 1 bolt installed to support
the VAM Pro bracket? It seems sturdy enough, nut just wanted to make sure.

Thanks,
Nick

On Sun, Aug 10, 2025 at 8:42 PM service@simsonn.com
Hi Nick Dodson,    The throttle design requires only one screw to secure the VAM, which is sufficient and poses no issues.
